revised_title: Fluid Dynamics and Water Budgets in Subduction Zones: A Comparative Study
tldr: This article compares fluid outflow from the toes of accretionary wedges in subduction zones based on various direct and indirect measurements. The authors find that the outflow is significantly larger than the volume of fluid released by compaction processes. They also discuss the influence of fluids in subduction zones, including the role of deep water convection and the smectite-illite transformation in water production.
